item.title: Strict ID Laws Could Block Thousands From Voting
item.description: Strict ID Laws Could Block Thousands From Voting http://t.co/zLG6Ejnd
item.content:encoded: Strict ID Laws Could Block Thousands From Voting http://t.co/zLG6Ejnd When Edward and Mary Weidenbener went to vote in Indiana's primary in May, they didn't realize that state law required them to bring government photo IDs such as a driver's license or passport. The husband and wife, both approaching 90 years old, had to use a temporary ballot that would be verified later, even though they knew the people working the polling site that day. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Google Announces Campaign To Legalize Same-Sex Marriage Worldwide
item.description: #GC77 Google announces plan to support same-sex marriage worldwide http://t.co/QfFwIg43
item.content:encoded: #GC77 Google announces plan to support same-sex marriage worldwide http://t.co/QfFwIg43 Google launched a new campaign on Saturday supporting the legalization of same-sex marriage around the world. Dot 429 reports that the initiative, called "Legalize Love," debuted in Poland and Singapore, and "will focus on places with homophobic cultures, where anti-gay laws exist," though it will operate in every city in which Google has an office. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Unemployment Rate Dropped In Every State That Elected A Republican Gov. In 2010
item.description: Unemployment Rate Dropped In Every State That Elected A Republican Gov. In 2010 http://t.co/RfoOaUCF via @sharethis
item.content:encoded: Unemployment Rate Dropped In Every State That Elected A Republican Gov. In 2010 http://t.co/RfoOaUCF via @sharethis In 2010, influenced by the Tea Party and its focus on fiscal issues, 17 states elected Republican governors. And, according to an Examiner.com analysis, every one of those states saw a drop in their unemployment rates since January of 2011. Furthermore, the average drop in the unemployment rate in these states was 1.35%, compared to the national decline of .9%, which means, according to the analysis, that the job market in these Republican states is improving 50% faster than the national rate. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com
